column3: This was a nice place with lots of water birds and a nice place to take a stroll. It was my first time visiting a marsh and it was beautiful. Saw some tadpoles in the pond as well. My friend and I walked about half and turned back. But I would go back to explore all of it next time I'm in the area.

column2: Wildlife oasis in the concrete jungle
column3: Tons of critters call this little plot home. Especially after it rains. Take a camera and be patient and you'll see more birds, lizards, and little furry critters than you imagined live in the City of Angels.

I love to come here by myself or with my grandsons to explore what is happening at the marsh. The marsh can be dry in the summer with lots of pathways to explore, or full of water in the spring with birds and frogs and water fowl. Any time of year, this is a wonderful spot to come for a respite. There's also a nature center that hosts lots of different kinds of events for adults and kids.

We found a quiet little Eden, right in the middle of Torrance. It's very quiet here. Especially when you figure that this is right next to Sepulveda Blvd.With the recent rains, the Marsh is alive with flowers and various critters, that we do not often see in So Cal.This is a great area to take the kiddies on a safe nature walk and let them experience the outdoors in a safe environment. Or, just take a walk yourself, and find some peace and tranquility.Either before your walk in the Marsh or after, your choice, visit the Visitor Center right across the street. Not across Sepulveda, the other way. There is much to learn about the Marsh and the various living things here that call this place home.

column2: Splendid spring jaunt in the city
column3: This is an oasis of nature in the center of a bustling suburban city. The abundant rains this year has brought forth an abundance of new life in the marsh and attracted many different birds. Just in one morning, spotted 3 different species of duck, coots, egrets, and a blue heron as well as visiting Canadian geese. Beautiful spot for a respite from the busy city.

column2: A Little Gem in the Midst of Bustle
column3: If you love nature, and even if you don't think you do, GO THERE! Especially now after the rains there are a plethora of wildlife! They have educational displays and a rockin gift shop. They also offer art classes for children and adults You will learn a lot!!

This place is a great way to get your car cleaned and have friendly people to help.The wash was fast and they do a thorough job of cleaning the inside and wiping the car down afterwards. The crew work in unison and hard. So if you decide to go, please also tip the hard working "cleanup" crew.

column2: Wonderful! What Torrance used to look like!
column3: This is a great place trying to preserve nature. All the plants and insects and things belong here and were here way before us. Such a wonderful place. Highly recommend volunteering and helping here.

column2: Great place for kids and for walks
column3: The nature center has a room that explains the flora and fauna of the marsh that includes hands-on features for the kids. The center also provides programs and volunteer opps for the whole family. Across the street, the marsh has walking trails to view what you just learned about at the nature center.

Madrona Marsh is a nature preserve right in the middle of Torrance that includes a pretty cool Nature Center. Spring is generally a good time to visit, after the rains leave the wetlands full of water, which attract many species of waterfowl.

I knew the marsh existed, but never knew about the Nature Center building. It has a big parking lot, very nice. There are all sorts of interesting exhibits, it's a kid's paradise. They got live critters, like turtles. And they have pelts, like a skunk's, so you can see what the animal looks like up close.
Great place to go for a walk, plant some trees, pull some weeds or help out on community service projects through schools, Boys Scouts or Girl Scouts.

I have gone here several times since it is walking distance from where my daughter lives. One time I did take my granddaughter there though and it said it was OPEN but it was locked and closed. Not sure why.
we live right by here, i dont see the attraction, but others seems to, seems to need some sprucing up, at least some more water

Learn about the history, plants and wildlife of the Torrance area with this unique sometimes guided tours of the Madronna Marsh. The Center also has special events at certain times like star tours that are informative.

column2: great place to take a walk
column3: who even knew this existed right behind the mall? great place to take a walk, take a pictures. enjoy nature.
Very nice place to walk, paint, photograph all of the native flora and fauna. Especially nice after a few days of rain.

column2: Great way to spend an hour with the kids
column3: Small marsh in the middle of the city. The marsh has a short trail around the perimeter. There are a couple of small ponds surround by trees, native plants, and wildlife (if you're lucky). The visitor center is small but very nice. Lots of displays of animals and plants you might see out in the Marsh.
The Madrona Marsh is a nice respite from the city. It is an oasis with nice short trails to walk around a body of water. I'm sure all the birds who live there enjoy it.

column2: Small marsh area; beautiful in spring
column3: I visited in late March and early April while the wildflowers were in bloom. The area is a beautiful oasis in an industrial area. The perimeter hike is only about a mile. There are ponds, trees, plants, and water fowl.
